name: 1.1 - Review Temporary Works Design Process Matrix
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm extent of temporary works required by reviewing the Temporary Works Design Process Matrix.
Reference Documents - Temporary Works Design Process Matrix
Record of conformity - Drawings and drawing registers
1.2 - Submission of Risk Assessment for relevant Temporary Works
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm the level of risk assessment documentation required for temporary works
Reference Documents - Temporary Works Design Process Matrix
1.3 - Submission of Temporary Works Brief for Temporary Works Designer
Acceptance Criteria - Completion of the temporary works design brief to highlight the scope and required design/deliverables for temporary works designer.
Reference Documents - Temporary Works Design Process Matrix Drawings
Record of conformity - Temporary Works Design Brief
1.4 - Submission of IFC Temporary Works Design Documentation
Acceptance Criteria - Submission of temporary works design documentation. Including but not limited to:
Reference Documents - Temporary Works Design Documentation Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Submission and review of subcontractor WMS / ITC and confirm alignment with temporary works design documentation
Reference Documents - Temporary Works Design Documentation
1.6 - Designer Certification check as Profession Engineer (NER / RPEV) – as required
Acceptance Criteria - Confirmation of Designers credentials on the National Engineering Register (NER) and/or Register of Professional Engineers Victoria (RPEV)
Reference Documents - Temporary Works Design Process Matrix
1.7 - Designer Validator Certification check as Profession Engineer (NER / RPEV)
Acceptance Criteria - Confirmation of Designer Validators credentials on the National Engineering Register (NER) and/or Register of Professional Engineers Victoria (RPEV)
Reference Documents - Temporary Works Design Process Matrix
1.8 - Update of relevant Safe Work Method Statement
Acceptance Criteria - Verification of updated SWMs demonstrating relevant safety controls / mitigations to eliminate hazards
Reference Documents - Temporary Works Design Process Matrix
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings.
– all drawings are the latest revision.
Reference Documents - Approved Temporary Works Design Documentation
Record of conformity - Drawings and drawing registers
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure all required materials are procured in accordance to approved shop drawing specifications / requirements.
Reference Documents - Approved Temporary Works Design Shop Drawings
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Provide manufacturer’s Certificate of Compliance against temporary works drawings.
Reference Documents - Approved Temporary Works Design Shop Drawings
Record of conformity - Supplier’s Certificate of Compliance
2.4 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls being implemented, that is PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP.
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Confirmation of ground conditions comply with the expected ground conditions as per geotechnical report / structural drawings.
Reference Documents - Approved Temporary Works Design Documentation
Record of conformity - Inspection report, Geotechnical report
Acceptance Criteria - Survey set out to be completed for all assets
Reference Documents - Approved Temporary Works Design Shop Drawings
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria - Verification of work described has been inspected and approval is given to construct in accordance with the temporary works design, detailed construction methodology, inspection and test plans, and risk assessment.
Reference Documents - Construction Methodology, Sequence Drawings
Record of conformity - Temporary works permit to construct, apply load and remove, Subcontractors ITC
Responsibility - Temporary Works Coordinator, Project Engineer
2.8 - Permit to Apply Load to Temporary Works

Acceptance Criteria - Verification the temporary works described have been constructed in accordance with the temporary works design, detailed construction methodology, inspection and test plans, risk assessment and all required checks carried out.
○ Any minor non-conformances between construction and design are to be noted.
Reference Documents - Construction Methodology, Sequence Drawings
Record of conformity - Temporary works permit to construct, apply load and remove, Subcontractors ITC
Responsibility - Temporary Works Coordinator, Project Engineer
2.9 - Routine Inspections (time, weather event, etc.) where applicable
Acceptance Criteria - Evidence that routine inspections as defined by the temporary work are undertaken (where applicable).
Reference Documents - Approved Temporary Works Design Documentation
Record of conformity - Inspection Report, Subcontractors ITC
Responsibility - Temporary Works Coordinator, Project Engineer

Acceptance Criteria - All necessary checks have been completed and the temporary works described may be removed in accordance with the detailed construction methodology, risk assessment and inspection and test plans.
Reference Documents - Construction Methodology, Sequence Drawings
Responsibility - Temporary Works Coordinator, Project Engineer
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure no remaining material is left behind and housekeeping completed.
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
